data.title: Best Hiking Trails in Grand Lake, CO
data.meta_description: Grand Lake, Colorado, has some of the most
data.text:
Grand Lake, Colorado, has some of the most breathtaking trails in the state, making it a paradise for hikers. This charming town offers stunning views, peaceful lakes, and abundant wildlife, making it the ideal spot for outdoor enthusiasts seeking adventure and tranquility. Whether you're an experienced hiker looking for a challenge or a family wanting a leisurely stroll in nature, Grand Lake has something for everyone. Get ready to put on your hiking boots and explore the natural beauty of Grand Lake, CO.

Adams Falls Trail

Difficulty: Easy

Length: 0.8 Miles Out & Back

Adams Falls Trail is one of the most iconic trails in Grand Lake, CO. This easy 0.8-mile out-and-back trail takes about 20 minutes to complete. At the end of this trail, hikers can view the raging waterfall, winding Colorado River and meadows. This trail is very popular for both hiking and horseback riding, so you can expect to encounter other adventurers along the way. While the trail is open year-round, the prime time to visit is between May and November.

East Inlet Trail

Difficulty: Hard

Length: 18 Miles Out and Back

If you go a little beyond the Adams Falls Trail, you’ll reach the East Inlet Trail. This 18.0-mile out-and-back trail is known for its challenging terrain. It typically takes about 8 hours to complete. Along this trail, you’ll get great views of the river, mountains, and lakes. It's a popular destination for backpacking, camping, and fishing, so expect to see fellow outdoor enthusiasts during your trek. The ideal months to visit are May through October.

Shadow Mountain Lookout

Difficulty: Moderate

Length: 9.6 Miles Out and Back

Discover this 9.6-mile out-and-back trail that leads to the Shadow Mountain Outlook. The Outlook was built in the 1930s to identify and observe forest fires. While it’s closed today, it is the last standing fire lookout in the Rocky Mountain National Park. Typically considered moderately challenging, it takes approximately 5 hours to complete. Popular for hiking, horseback riding, and snowshoeing, this trail also offers solitude during quieter times. Open year-round, it showcases beauty in every season.

Cascade Falls

Difficulty: Easy

Length: 6.8 Miles Out and Back

Starting at the North Inlet Trailhead, hike the 3.4 miles to Cascade Falls. Considered an easy hike, it typically takes about 2 and a half hours to complete. When you reach the top of the falls, bring a picnic to enjoy the waterside. The best time to visit is from May through October.

Please Note: This trail was affected by wildfires in October 2020 so please stay on the trail so the nature around the trail can regrow.

East Shore Trail

Difficulty: Easy

Length: 5.8 Miles Out and Back

The East Shore Trail runs along Shadow Mountain Reservoir, making it the perfect destination for a hike with waterfront views. This 5.8-mile out-and-back hike is considered easy and takes approximately 2 hours to complete. Along this trail you’ll encounter many little beaches to stop and take a breather and maybe dip your toes in the cool water.

Colorado River Trail to Lulu City

Difficulty: Moderate

Length: 7.3 Miles Out and Back

This trail is the hike to take if you enjoy history. This trail takes you to the abandoned mining town that has tons of historic features like old mine shafts and cabin ruins. The town is about 3.7 miles from the trailhead entrance. Along the way, you’ll follow the Colorado River, which makes the trail shaded and cool during the summer months.

Coyote Valley Trail

Difficulty: Easy

Length: 1.9 Miles Out & Back

This trail is perfect for families! The trail is leveled, making it wheelchair accessible, and it has a number of benches for your family to stop and enjoy nature. The trail is about a mile long, with fishing opportunities along the trail. There are even picnic tables at the beginning of the trail to bring a picnic for your family to enjoy.

Book your Grand Lake Vacation Rental

After exploring the best hiking trails in Grand Lake, CO, it's clear why this stunning destination is a must-visit for outdoor enthusiasts. As you plan your next adventure, consider making Grand Lake your home base. With a variety of vacation rentals available, you can find the perfect place to relax and rejuvenate after a day on the trails. Don't miss out on the chance to experience the magic of Grand Lake—book your vacation rental today and start planning your unforgettable mountain getaway.
